titleStmt.title: Contract for Purchase and Delivery of Radish Oil (Paid Requisition)
titleStmt.author: Flavius Kyrillos, princeps of the officium of the praeses of Arcadia

msContents.summary: Receipt, issued by Flavius Kyrillos, princeps officii praesidis provinciae Arcadiae, to two Alexandrian councillors, for 150 solidi with which he is to have 9000 sextarii of radish oil purchased and delivered to the harbor of the Arsinoite nome

msItemStruct.note: The document has been cancelled by chiasm, indicating that the agreement was fulfilled.
Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: Broken off on the left side

origin.origPlace: Herakleopolis (Magna), Herakleopolite nome, province of Arcadia, Egypt
origin.persName: Flavius Kyrillos, princeps taxeos hegemonias eparchias Arkadias
Flavius Lausus Horigenes, hegemon of Arkadia

provenance.p: probably either Arsinoite or Herakleopolite nome, province of Arcadia, Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Herakleopolis, eparchia Arkadia; Alexandria; Arsinoites; hormos of the Arsinoite nome (Ptolemais Hormou?)

div.ab: [The year after] the consulship of the most illustrious Constantius and the most illustrious Constans, Mesore 26. In Herakleopolis in the province of Arcadia.;[Flavius Kyrillos, princeps] of the officium of the praeses of Arcadia, to Flavius Areios, councillor of the great city of Alexandria, and Flavius Theopemptos, councillor of the same city.;[In accordance with the orders] of my lord Flavius Lausus Horigenes, the most illustrious praeses of the province of Arcadia, I have received from you out of the [account] for the provisioning of [the great city] of Alexandria for the purchase of radish oil, on behalf of the citizens of Arsinoe, gold solidi of full weight, one hundred fifty in number, [and I am prepared to] deliver to you for each solidus sixty sextarii of oil, grand total 9000 sextarii. These I shall deliver [in the harbor of the] Arsinoite nome by the measure sent out by you from the great city of Alexandria whenever you desire, [without delay or] argument; and I swear by Almighty God and the holy reverence and victory of our lords [Honorius and Theodosius] the eternal Augusti that I will make delivery of the oil and have engaged in no deceit. The contract is valid and when asked the formal question [I so declared].;(2nd hand) I, Flavius Kyrillos, princeps, have received from you on behalf of the citizens of Arsinoe for the purchase of [radish oil] one hundred fifty gold solidi for nine thousand sextarii; and these [I will deliver when] you desire in the harbor of the Arsinoite nome as stated, and when asked the formal question I so declared and had this document prepared.;(1st hand) Drawn up by me, Heraiskos.

listBibl.bibl: Shelton JC, PMich XI, 613, 1971, pl. III -- BL VII, 115 (l. 3)
